title: Vegetarian Enchiladas
description: A relatively healthy (and entirely delicious) take on classic enchiladas.

directions.text: Bring water to a boil, then add the corn. Once the corn is done, boil the broccoli in the same water. Once cooked, cut the corn off the cob and chop the broccoli.
Chop the onion, then start sautèing them in a large pan with some olive oil over medium-high heat. This pan will eventually hold all the ingredients, so make sure the it's large enough!
Rinse and drain the black beans.

Chop the jalepeño, the red and green bell peppers, and the garlic. De-seed the jalepeño unless you like your enchiladas spicy. Once the onions have had some time to sautè, add all the vegetables to the pan and sautè until tender.
Add the green chiles and let cook for a minute.
Add the cream cheese and stir until melted.
Add the broccoli, beans, and corn, stirring to combine and heat.
Grease an 8" x 11" baking dish. This will hold the enchiladas.

Fill the tortillas with the mixture, and line the pan with them. Don't be afraid to squash them together a bit to make them all fit! Once the pan is full, cover it in the Mexican-blend cheese, then pour the half-and-half over everything.
Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes. If you like softer cheese, cover the pan with foil. Leave it uncovered for a crispier top.

notes: For a great side dish add a bit of the filling to a can of corn, add some salsa or chopped chipotle peppers, then heat and serve.
